author: Staff Reporter
text:
A 37-year-old man who allegedly impersonated as an official from Tamil Nadu Minerals Limited (TAMIN) was arrested by the Sholavandan police on Tuesday.

According to the police, the accused, S. Ramasubramanian (37) from Karupatti village in Vadipatti taluk, was involved in vehicle check at the Kattakulam intersection in Vadipatti to Sholavandan Road when he was nabbed.

He had allegedly stopped the tractor of M. Prabhu (32) from Thenkarai village, carrying a load of stone aggregate, by claiming himself to be an official from TAMIN.

Despite showing relevant documents, Ramasubramanian allegedly took Rs. 100 as bribe from Prabhu.

Meanwhile, personnel from Sholavandan police station who incidentally came to the spot questioned Ramasubramanian and found that he was impersonating.

Case booked

The police booked a case and arrested him later.
title: Man impersonating as TAMIN official arrested
